item.title: 印度 Infosys 第一季度收入超预期，上调全年增长预期
item.description: 印度第二大 IT 服务公司 Infosys 周四公布的季度营收超过预期，主要得益于金融服务和制造业客户需求的复苏。【原文：India's No.2 IT services firm Infosys beat quarterly revenue estimates on Thursday, helped by a recovery in demand from clients in its financial services and manufacturing verticals.】

item.title: 多米诺比萨因需求低迷，季度销售额略低于预期
item.description: 周四，多米诺比萨公司（Domino's Pizza）第二季度同店销售额低于市场预期，原因是美国消费者，尤其是低收入群体，减少了外出就餐或叫外卖的消费。【原文：Domino's Pizza fell short of market expectations for second-quarter same-store sales on Thursday as U.S. consumers, particularly in the lower-income group, spent less on eating out or ordering in.】

item.title: 早间竞价：台积电稳定芯片价格，欧洲央行和 Netflix 备受关注
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 消息人士称，埃克森与雪佛龙的冲突取决于赫斯圭亚那资产控制权的变更
item.description: 据知情人士透露，埃克森美孚通过法律手段阻止雪佛龙公司以 530 亿美元收购赫斯公司的提议，关键在于该交易是否会涉及赫斯公司在圭亚那的子公司控制权的变更。【原文：Exxon Mobil's legal bid to stop Chevron's proposed $53 billion acquisition of Hess rests on whether the transaction would involve a change of control of Hess' prize subsidiary in Guyana, according to people knowledgeable about the argument.】

item.title: 台积电业绩提振半导体股，纳斯达克期货跳涨
item.description: 周四，芯片股反弹提振了纳斯达克指数和 S&P 500 指数期货，原因是台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（台积电）的乐观预期和业绩在前一交易日大幅下挫后似乎将提振该板块。【原文：A rebound in chip stocks lifted Nasdaq and S&P 500 futures on Thursday as Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co's (TSMC) upbeat forecast and results looked set to boost the sector following a sharp selloff in the previous session.】

item.title: 中国承诺进行工业现代化和其他一系列改革
item.description: 中国共产党的一次重要会议结束后，中国国家媒体称，中国领导人周四承诺实现国家工业综合体的现代化，扩大内需，抑制债务和房地产行业的风险，并实施金融和财政改革。【原文：Chinese leaders pledged on Thursday to modernise the country's industrial complex, expand domestic demand, curb debt and property sector risks, as well as implement financial and fiscal reforms, state media said after a key Communist Party meeting.】

item.title: 中国战略锗的价格因国家可能购买而创下历史新高
item.description: 行业消息人士称，受国家可能购买的猜测推动，芯片制造的关键战略金属锗的价格在周三创下了中国最大生产国的历史新高。【原文：Prices of germanium, a strategic metal key to chipmaking, hit a record high on Wednesday in top producer China, driven by speculation of possible state buying, industry sources said.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局称现代汽车美国公司将召回近6.7万辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周四表示，现代汽车美国公司将在美国召回近67,000辆汽车。【原文：Hyundai Motor America is recalling nearly 67,000 vehicles in the U.S., the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday.】

item.title: 干邑高管和欧盟官员出席北京白兰地倾销听证会
item.description: 法国干邑协会在一份声明中说，法国干邑公司的高管和欧盟官员周四在北京出席了与中国对欧盟白兰地反倾销调查有关的听证会。【原文：Executives from French cognac companies and European Union officials on Thursday attended a hearing in Beijing related to China's anti-dumping investigation into EU brandy, the French cognac association said in a statement.】

item.title: 航运巨头达飞轮船公司与谷歌签署人工智能协议
item.description: 法国航运和物流公司达飞海运（CMA CGM）（CMACG.UL）与 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司（Google）周四宣布，双方已签署合作协议，将在全球范围内加快部署人工智能解决方案。【原文：French shipping and logistics company CMA CGM (CMACG.UL) has signed a partnership with Alphabet's Google to speed up deployment of AI solutions across its operations worldwide, the two companies announced on Thursday.】

item.title: 监督机构称，20 国集团部分金融监管机构忽视了与自然损失相关的风险
item.description: 二十国集团（G20）金融监督机构的一份报告发现，由于数据不足，一些 G20 国家的金融监管机构和监管人员忽视了生物多样性丧失和森林砍伐所带来的风险，而把重点放在了气候风险上。【原文：Financial regulators and supervisors in some G20 countries are overlooking the risks posed by biodiversity loss and deforestation because of insufficient data, focusing instead on climate risks, a report by the G20's financial watchdog found.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚总统表示，塞尔维亚希望与梅赛德斯、斯泰兰蒂斯和大众汽车达成锂交易
item.description: 塞尔维亚总统表示，塞尔维亚将为梅赛德斯-奔驰、大众汽车和斯坦兰蒂斯提供购买汽车电池锂的机会，因为塞尔维亚优先考虑欧洲而不是中国的汽车制造商。【原文：Serbia will give Mercedes-Benz , Volkswagen and Stellantis the opportunity to purchase lithium for car batteries as the nation prioritises European over Chinese carmakers, its president said.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称，受客户退出影响，普华永道将削减中国合伙人薪酬
item.description: 两位知情人士透露，普华永道（PwC）已要求其在中国的合伙人减薪最多 50%，原因是监管部门对该公司的调查以及一些企业客户的离职促使该公司削减成本和裁员。【原文：PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) has asked its China-based partners to take a pay cut of up to 50%, two people with knowledge of the matter said, as a regulatory probe into the firm and departure of some of its corporate clients prompt cost cuts and layoffs.】

item.title: 苏伊士运河收入下降，部分托运人避开红海
item.description: 苏伊士运河的年收入在最近一个财政年度下降了近四分之一，原因是一些托运人为躲避与伊朗结盟的胡塞武装分子在红海发动的袭击而改走其他航线。【原文：The Suez Canal's annual revenue dropped by almost a quarter in its latest financial year as some shippers switched to alternative routes to avoid attacks by Iran-aligned Houthis in the Red Sea.】

item.title: 欧股高开，欧洲央行利率决议即将出炉
item.description: 欧洲股市周四在能源股的带动下高开高走，投资者还在等待欧洲央行当天晚些时候的利率决定。【原文：European shares opened higher on Thursday led by energy stocks, while investors also awaited the European Central Bank's interest rate decision, due later in the day.】

item.title: 德国住宅建筑许可下降速度加快，凸显危机四伏
item.description: 德国统计局周四公布的数据显示，5月份德国公寓建筑许可同比下降了24%，凸显了建筑和房地产业需求的持续低迷。【原文：Building permits for apartments in Germany fell 24% in May from a year earlier, Statistics Office data showed on Thursday, underscoring a continued downturn in demand in the construction and real estate industry.】

item.title: 日本经济新闻》报道：日本央行希望维持宽松的货币环境
item.description: 据日本时事通讯社周四报道，日本央行一位高级官员表示，央行希望尽可能维持宽松的货币环境。【原文：A senior Bank of Japan official said the central bank wants to maintain an accommodative monetary environment as much as possible, Jiji news agency reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 英国薪酬增长放缓，但对英格兰银行而言仍处于高位
item.description: 在截至 5 月底的三个月里，英国工人的工资增长速度有所放缓，但仍保持在英国央行通常无法将通胀率控制在 2% 目标之内的过高水平。【原文：Growth in wages for workers in Britain slowed in the three months to the end of May but remained at levels that would normally be too high for the Bank of England to keep inflation at its 2% target.】

item.title: 卡车制造商沃尔沃利润超预期，称需求持续正常化
item.description: 瑞典卡车制造商沃尔沃公司（AB Volvo）周四公布的第二季度营业利润增幅高于预期，并表示与 2023 年的高水平相比，需求继续趋于正常。【原文：Swedish truck maker AB Volvo reported on Thursday a bigger rise than expected in second-quarter operating profit and said demand continued to normalise compared with the high levels of 2023.】

item.title: 台积电第二季度利润增长 36%，好于预期
item.description: 台湾芯片制造商台积电周四公布的第二季度净利润增长 36%，超出市场预期，原因是人工智能应用领域对半导体的需求激增。【原文：Taiwanese chipmaker TSMC posted a 36% rise in second-quarter net profit on Thursday that beat market expectations as it rides a surge in demand for semiconductors used in artificial intelligence applications.】

item.title: 雷诺上半年销量增长 1.9
item.description: 法国汽车制造商雷诺（Renault）周四表示，由于其混合动力汽车在欧洲这一主要地区的强劲表现，该公司上半年的销量与去年同期相比增长了1.9%。【原文：French automaker Renault said on Thursday its first-half sales volume rose 1.9% compared to the same period a year earlier due to strong performance of its hybrids in Europe, its key region.】

item.title: 广告公司阳狮在第二季度业绩超预期后上调了指导原则
item.description: 法国广告集团阳狮集团周四上调了第二季度的有机增长预期，这主要得益于其 Epsilon 和媒体部门两位数的增长。【原文：French advertising group Publicis upgraded its organic growth guidance on Thursday after beating expectations for the second quarter, boosted by double digit growth in its Epsilon and Media branches.】

item.title: 解说员：根据最新的疑似干预，日本的策略是什么？
item.description: 日本本月被怀疑多次干预外汇市场以支撑日元，这凸显出日本对货币下跌给家庭带来的进口成本上涨的痛苦感到不安。【原文：Japan is suspected to have intervened in the foreign exchange market to prop up the yen on several occasions this month, underscoring its discomfort over the pain the currency's fall is inflicting on households because of costlier imports.】

item.title: 由于电信设备需求疲软，诺基亚第二季度利润下降 32
item.description: 芬兰电信设备制造商诺基亚周四表示，由于对 5G 电信设备的需求依然疲软，公司第二季度营业利润下降了 32%。【原文：Finnish telecom equipment maker Nokia said on Thursday its operating profit fell 32% in the second quarter, as demand for 5G telecom equipment remained weak.】

item.title: 新加坡中央银行预计 2024 年经济增长将接近 2-3%的潜在增长率
item.description: 新加坡央行行长周四表示，新加坡全年的经济增长率将更接近2%至3%的潜在增长率，核心通胀率预计将在今年最后一个季度出现更明显的缓解。【原文：Singapore's full-year economic growth will come in closer to its potential rate of 2% to 3% and core inflation is expected to ease more significantly in the final quarter of the year, the head of its central bank said on Thursday.】

item.title: 沃尔沃汽车公司第二季度运营收益超出预期
item.description: 瑞典汽车制造商沃尔沃汽车公司（Volvo Cars）周四公布的第二季度营业利润大幅增长，显示出该行业在疲软的电动汽车（EV）市场中的韧性。【原文：Swedish automaker Volvo Cars reported a significant beat in second-quarter operating earnings on Thursday, demonstrating resilience in an industry grappling with a weak electric vehicle (EV) market.】

item.title: 第二季度盈利不佳，挪威电信上调 2024 年销售预期
item.description: 挪威电信运营商挪威电信公司（Telenor）周四上调了2024年的销售预期，此前该公司第二季度的盈利达到了市场预期。【原文：Norwegian telecom operator Telenor raised its 2024 sales expectations on Thursday after its second-quarter earnings met market expectations.】

item.title: 轮换交易让小盘股从死钱变成华尔街宠儿
item.description: 受降息预期和共和党总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普当选前景改善的影响，美国小型股迎来了期待已久的时刻。【原文：U.S. small-cap stocks are having a long-awaited moment, ignited by expectations of interest rate cuts and improving prospects for the election of Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump, a proponent of policies seen as benefiting smaller domestic companies.】

item.title: 早间竞价：贸易紧张局势加剧，芯片价格下跌
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 中美芯片战深化，亚洲科技股下滑
item.description: 周四，亚洲芯片股暴跌，追随华尔街受美国正酝酿收紧对华先进半导体技术出口的新闻报道刺激而出现的大幅下挫。【原文：Chip stocks in Asia tumbled on Thursday, tracking a heavy selloff on Wall Street spurred by a news report that the United States was mulling tighter curbs on exports of advanced semiconductor technology to China.】
